I had that happen to me yesterday, installed 10.04 server 32bit. The install process claimed to have installed grub, but it apparantly didn't. I can boot into the system from the cd, but the boot just hangs without it. I plan to check it out on Tuesday, and likely have to reinstall grub2.
don't you have to have a special drive for a 2.88 flop ?
this is going to be used as a PXE boot option.
thanks.  I am actually looking to create a  DOS bootable floppy image.

Okay, here's what I did (because my windows box doesn't have a floppy):   dd if=/dev/fd0 of=floppy.img.  Then I copied floppy.img to my windows box and opened it with a program called winimage.  Winimage has a change format tool.  I changed the format to 2.88, and copied the image back to the linux box.
now all that's left is to add in the files I needed the extra space for, load it into the tftp folder and try a PXE boot.
Hi.  That procedure for expanding the boot floppy image worked like a charm.
